PURPOSE : This clinical trial study well immunoscintigraphy use radiolabeled monoclonal antibody work find tumor cell patient colorectal cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Immunoscintigraphy Using Radiolabeled Monoclonal Antibody Finding Tumor Cells Patients With Colorectal Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To determine ability iodine I 123 anti-CEA recombinant diabody T84.66 localize colorectal cancer , determine quantitative radioimmunoscintigraphy patient colorectal cancer . Secondary - To evaluate clinical pharmacokinetics iodine I 123 anti-CEA recombinant diabody T84.66 clearance patient . - To characterize frequency titer human anti-chimeric response iodine I 123 anti-CEA recombinant diabody T84.66 patient . - To determine safety iodine I 123 anti-CEA recombinant diabody T84.66 patient . OUTLINE : Patients receive infusion iodine I 123 anti-CEA recombinant diabody T84.66 . Patients undergo planar image every 5 minute radiolabeled antibody infusion 3-6 hr , 12-24 hour , , indicate , 30-48 hour radiolabeled antibody infusion . Planar spot image head , chest , abdomen , pelvis whole body image ( anterior posterior ) take . Patients also undergo SPECT scan abdomen pelvis 12 24 hour radiolabeled antibody infusion . Blood sample collect pharmacokinetic analysis immediately radiolabeled antibody infusion 15 minute , 30 minute , 1 hour , 2 hour , 4 hour radiolabeled antibody infusion . Patients follow periodically 6 month .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically confirm colorectal cancer Stage IIV disease PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Serum creatinine < 2.0 mg/dL Total bilirubin < 2.0 mg/dL Hemoglobin > 9.0 g/dL cT84.66 antibody negative ( previously treat mouse chimeric immunoglobulin ) Not pregnant No condition , opinion investigator , would preclude study compliance No known allergy iodine No known history HIV , hepatitis B , hepatitis C PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No concurrent steroid
